page.title: 04Houses in Parkfield area
page.content: Many houses in the Parkfield area are old. You can tell how old they are by looking at their bricks. One house has a date on it, 1938. Nearly all the houses around the Parkfield area are council houses. People who cannot afford to buy their own rent them. There is a block of flats in the area built in the 1950s. Some people live in terraced houses others in semi- detached. The council houses are semi-detached too. Most of the council houses were built in the 1930s and the terraced houses are even older. Some of the terraced houses date from last century and are not all occupied. The oldest house in Parkfield is on the Birmingham New Rd., near to our school. It used to be four miners'homes which were terraced & had four chimneys. Two local houses had to be rebuilt after bombing in the Second World war.
